revised_title: Vocalizations and Communication in the Aldabra White-throated Rail
tldr: This study examines the vocal repertoire and communication functions of the Aldabra white-throated rail, a flightless bird found on Aldabra Atoll. Ten distinct categories of vocalizations are identified and analyzed in relation to their behavioral contexts. The research highlights the importance of vocalizations in communication between individuals, particularly in maintaining contact between mated pairs and defending territories. The findings contribute to our understanding of avian communication and behavioral ecology.
